article.title: The coalescing colony model: mean-field, scaling, and geometry

choices: The area of the primary colony over time for different emission rates.
The radius of the primary colony over time for different emission rates with a constant emission distance.
The radius of the secondary colony over time for different emission rates.
The perimeter of the primary colony over time for different emission rates.

multiple_choice_question.text: What relationship is depicted in this plot?
choices: The relationship between the average radius of a secondary colony and the emission distance.
The relationship between the radial velocity of the primary colony and the ratio of emission to coalescence time.
The relationship between the area of the primary colony and the emission rate.
The relationship between the perimeter of the primary colony and the ratio of emission to coalescence time.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the exponent Î² in this context?
choices: It represents the scaling exponent for the radius of the primary colony over time.
It represents the scaling exponent for the area of the primary colony over time.
It represents the ratio between emission and coalescence time.
It represents the average radius of a secondary colony just before coalescence.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the functions f1(l) and f2(l) represent in this plot?
choices: Corrections to the circular approximation for the area and perimeter of the primary colony, respectively.
The relationship between the radius of the primary colony and the emission distance.
The probability distribution of secondary colonies around the primary colony.
The relationship between the average radius of a secondary colony and the emission distance.
